title: Upgrading and Repairing PCs (22nd Ed)(gnv64)
description:
Upgrading and Repairing PCs (22nd Ed)
by Scott Mueller
Que Publishing | July 2015 | ISBN-10: 0789756102 | ePUB | 48.6 MB

This 22nd edition continues to deliver the most authoritative, current, and comprehensive reference on everything associated with computer hardware; includes an instructional and reference DVD; and an online "Bonus Content" that includes additional videos and the complete 19th and 20th editions of this book (in PDF format). Since this book contains older and obsolete information that is readily available in prior online PDF editions, future editions might eliminate much of this information for a smaller but more current tome. Technical data changes too fast to be current, but the historical perspectives, conceptual diagrams and figures, and how-to techniques that reference online data sources would be invaluable.
The historical backgrounds are especially invaluable in understanding the current state of computer hardware and how we got there. This information is probably available on the Internet by searching multiple sites, but in this book it is already all there in one place in a very easy to understand format. The time saved from this convenience can not be overstated.
To supplement this book Scott Mueller still has a forum website for updated information, questions, and comments related to all aspects of the book. In addition the Que Store book reference page also has excellent free DVD videos, resources, and articles to supplement this book (that are updated daily).

About the Author
Scott Mueller is the president of Mueller Technical Research (MTR), an international research and corporate training firm. Since 1982, MTR has produced the industryâ€™s most in-depth, accurate, and effective seminars, books, articles, videos, and FAQs covering PC hardware and data recovery. MTR maintains a client list that includes Fortune 500 companies, U.S. and foreign governments, major software and hardware corporations, as well as PC enthusiasts and entrepreneurs. Scottâ€™s seminars have been presented to several thousands of PC support professionals throughout the world.
Scott personally teaches seminars nationwide covering all aspects of PC hardware (including troubleshooting, maintenance, repair, and upgrade), A+ Certification, and data recovery/forensics. He has a knack for making technical topics not only understandable, but entertaining; his classes are never boring! If you have ten or more people to train, Scott can design and present a custom seminar for your organization.
Although he has taught classes virtually nonstop since 1982, Scott is best known as the author of the longest-running, most popular, and most comprehensive PC hardware book in the world, Upgrading and Repairing PCs, which has become the core of an entire series of books, including Upgrading and Repairing PCs, Upgrading and Repairing Laptops, and Upgrading and Repairing Windows.
Scottâ€™s premiere work, Upgrading and Repairing PCs, has sold more than two million copies, making it by far the most popular and longest-running PC hardware book on the market today. Scott has been featured in Forbes magazine and has written several articles for PC World magazine, Maximum PC magazine, the Scott Mueller Forum, various computer and automotive newsletters, and the Upgrading and Repairing PCs website.

CONTENTS
Introduction
1 Development of the PC
2 PC Components, Features, and System Design
3 Processor Types and Specifications
4 Motherboards and Buses
5 BIOS
6 Memory
7 The ATA/IDE Interface
8 Magnetic Storage
9 Flash and Removable Storage
10 Optical Storage
11 Video Hardware
12 Audio Hardware
13 External I/O Interfaces
14 Input Devices
15 Internet Connectivity
16 Local Area Networking
17 Power Supplies
18 Building or Upgrading Systems
19 PC Diagnostics, Testing, and Maintenance
